post.body: That's the idea. The U.S. implemented mCOOL (country of origin labeling), Canada is protesting. I want to see what our beef says.
I have ADD. Sometimes, I can't be followed.
The winters suck. Like a hoover in a blue dress on steroids.
Yeah, if it weren't for all the money he was making, I'd feel sorry for the kid with all the pressure.
I was referring to the ignorance comment you had made. Nothing to see here, carry on. :)
Bastard.
Your people are from Manitoba too?
Tough world to live in, with standards like those. I'm the anti-social living proof of it.
Yep, all 10 hours to Winnipeg... with hyper-as-hell kids in the back. "Valium, valium, valium all the way... oh what fun..."
Nah, we can go out a few more times,including taking the long way home to Saskatchewan. We'll find one!
Best card of the year. Still, I hate feeding the beast. I miss Pride.
Someone, please, rescue me from my mom's house. It's only two storeys, if I jump, I might survive.
"11th bear he's harvested," Harvested is watered-down spin. Much like collateral damage. Added to the "what I hate about the world list".
Off to photograph beef at grocery stores. Exciting, I know, but country of origin is a hot issue right now.
Priapism = making the best of a bad situation.
Family is good on a tree. In a house for four days, not so much.
Okay, Pittsburgh Penguins, your retro jersey was gay then and it's still gay now. Seriously. And we wonder why Crosby is so goal impotent.
In 15 years, I will move to Boliva forever and build the Swiss Family Robinson treehouse.
Yes, I must find a way to get down to South Dakota next month. If for nothing else, to defend Canada's reputation for drinking prowess.
2009 wardrobe secured. 2 grey hoodies, 2 brown hoodies, 1 Buck Fush t-shirt and a used pair of jeans. Yeah, score one for the underdressed.
